reviewText: I own this documentary in video form but wanted the DVD. I saw it on History Channel and then have watched it several times since on my own copies. The title makes me cringe, since I hate the word "frat," but the film is well-made. It moves back and forth between two narrative lines: a history of fraternities with a look at issues they face now, and the story of an Ole Miss freshman going through fraternity rush, being recruited by a fraternity where his brother, father, grandfather and great-grandfather were members.
It brought back many memories of my bids, and pledge for DELTA TAU DELTA in 1990 at Morehead State University. This is how it works out.
